div.p: Quantifying Maintainability in Quantifying Maintainability in Feature Oriented Product LinesFeature Oriented Product Lines
G. Aldekoa1, S.Trujillo2, G.Sagardui1, O.Daz3 1: Universidad de Mondragon 2: IKERLAN 3: Universidad del Pas Vasco
Problem Statement: Product-Line Maintenance Work Done Lessons Learned and Ongoing Work

Software Product Line (SPL) is a set of software-intensive systems that share a common, managed set of features satisfying the specific needs of a particular market segment or mission and that are developed from a common set of core assets in a prescribed way Clements and Northrop, 2001 FOP is a paradigm to SPL development where features are the building blocks of products Features are units incrementing application functionality by which different products can be distinguished and defined within an SPL.

The ease with which a software system can be modified to correct faults, improve performance, or adapt to a changing environment The capability of the software product to be modified. [IEEE Standard Computer Dictionary ]

Maintainability index (SEI), Using Polynomial regression model A greater MI means more maintainable. Case Studies: [Coleman 94], [Welker 95],[Zhuo 93], [Pearse 95] Tools to measure C, Java (Semantic Designs, Understand)

aveV is the average Halstead Volume V per module. aveV(g') is the average extended Cyclomatic Complexity per module. aveLOC is the average count of Lines Of Code (LOC) per module. perCM is the average percent of Lines of Comments per module.
Distinct quality dimensions SPL quality <> Products quality
Distinct quality dimensions SPL quality <> Products quality
Change probability Probability of Change (SPL) > Probability of Change (Product)
Problem Statement: Product-Line Maintenance Work Done Lessons Learned and Ongoing Work
We have: Jak code Override existing code
Problem: 1) Tooling unavailable 2) Measurement of refinements need further study
Remind a single product has MI Each product has a set of features (belonging to the SPL) Should be possible to get features MI from products? Stay tuned
Feature Model Case Studies A simple SPL was developed
Problems was developed by us consisted only of a few
Feature Model Case Studies A simple SPL was developed
An SPL provided by AHEAD Tool Suite was used Graph Product Line
Measure products MI and extrapolating feature impact
(2) MI for each product was measured using available (SemanticDesigns) tooling
(3) A system of equations with these results was created A matrix where the rows contain equations One row per product and One column per feature
(4) MatLab was used to resolve the matrix equation system
MI_vector is a vector with all the MI values of products PF is a matrix specifying product features
(5) The resolution of the equation provides the maintainability values for each feature
u t s r q p
Developers can improve specific features (depending on the MI impact)
Developers and Customers can use automated reasoning to establish SPL or Product quality levels
Problem Statement: Product-Line Maintenance Work Done Lessons Learned and Ongoing Work
Dependencies among Features Impact of Order
Monotonicity Overriding different code, impact is different.
Artefact Heterogeneity Not only code is maintained, there are other artefacts.
Generality of Experiences What happens with other paradigms?
Quantification of Feature Maintainability Provides a number of benefits: Identification of risk areas
Quantification of Software Product Lines Maintainability Provides a number of benefits:
Compare different global-SPL Maintainability Establish maintainability risk limits Predict maintenance cost of individual product Support of design decisions Reasoning on maintenance
